articles.title: Discovery of large scale tensor mode and chaotic inflation in supergravity
articles.abstract: The BICEP2 collaboration has recently reported a large tensor fluctuation in the cosmic microwave background, which suggests chaotic inflation models. In this letter, we reconsider the chaotic inflation model in the supergravity.

articles.title: Supersymmetry and inflation: A new approach
articles.abstract: In this paper we present a systematic study of inflationary phase transitions in locally supersymmetric theories.

articles.title: The development of irregularities in a single bubble inflationary universe
articles.abstract: The horizon, flatness and monopole problems can be solved if the universe underwent an exponentially expanding stage which ended with a Higgs scalar field running slowly down an effective potential.

articles.title: Effect of supergravity on heat transfer characteristics of PCM with the pore-scale lattice Boltzmann method
articles.abstract: Latent thermal energy storage has been recommended as an effective technique to the thermal management system of space exploration due to its excellent ability of storing thermal energy.

articles.title: Thermal analysis of void cavity for heat pipe receiver under microgravity
articles.abstract: Based on theoretical analysis of PCM (Phase Change Material) solidification process, the model of improved void cavity distribution tending to high temperature region is established.

articles.title: On the smallness of the cosmological constant
articles.abstract: In N = 1 supergravity the scalar potential of the hidden sector may have degenerate supersymmetric (SUSY) and non-supersymmetric Minkowski vacua.

articles.title: Fixed point scenario in the two Higgs doublet model inspired by degenerate vacua
articles.abstract: We consider the renormalisation group flow of Higgs and Yukawa couplings within the simplest non-supersymmetric two Higgs doublet extension of the Standard Model (SM).

articles.title: Electroweak Higgs potential and vacuum stability
articles.abstract: In electroweak models, radiative corrections to the scalar potential can have significant consequences.
